Helper for aligning your data to the dictionary

Source: R/msf_dict_rename_helper.R
msf_dict_rename_helper.Rd

Helper for aligning your data to the dictionary

msf_dict_rename_helper(
  disease,
  varnames = "data_element_shortname",
  copy_to_clipboard = TRUE
)

Arguments

disease

Specify which disease you would like to use. Currently supports "Cholera", "Measles" and "Meningitis", "AJS".
varnames

Specify name of column that contains varnames. Currently default set to "Item". (this can probably be deleted once dictionaries standardise) If dictionary is "Mortality", varnames needs to be "column_name"`.
copy_to_clipboard

if TRUE (default), the rename template will be copied to the user's clipboard with clipr::write_clip(). If FALSE, the rename template will be printed to the user's console.

Value

a dplyr command used to rename columns in your data frame according to the dictionary

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
